thread.title_full: India pip South Africa in thrilling women's World Cup qualifier final : Cricket, News - India Today

title: India pip South Africa in thrilling women's World Cup qualifier final : Cricket, News - India Today
text:
Cricket India pip South Africa in thrilling women's World Cup qualifier final Chasing a decent 245, India pipped South Africa by one wicket in a nail-biting Women's cricket World Cup qualifier final in Colombo on Tuesday. IANS | Posted by Natasha Singh India pipped South Africa by one wicket 2 India were on course with opener Mona Meshram and Deepti Sharma striking a 124-run second wicket stand 3 Harmanpreet's run-a-ball unbeaten 41 runs helped the side recover from a mini-collapse 
Riding on all-rounder Harmanpreet Kaur's late-order heroics with the willow, India pipped South Africa by one wicket in a nail-biting Women's cricket World Cup qualifier final at the P. Sara Oval here on Tuesday. 
Chasing a decent 245, India were on course with opener Mona Meshram (59) and Deepti Sharma (71) striking a 124-run second wicket stand to set the tone before Harmanpreet's run-a-ball unbeaten 41 runs helped the side recover from a mini-collapse and get over the line. ( ICC Women's World Cup: India beat South Africa, edge closer to qualification ) 
While Meshram's 82-ball knock was laced with seven boundaries and a six, Deepti consumed 89 balls and hit eight fours in her innings. Top order batswoman Veda Krishnamurthy, who came in after the Deepti's fall contributed with a 27-ball 31 containing three boundaries. 
With India needing 36 runs from the last six overs, medium pacer Ayabonga Khaka turned the tide in favour of South Africa picking two quick wickets and reduce India to 237/9. ( Indian eves thrash Sri Lanka in cricket World Cup qualifier ) 
However, Harmanpreet, who played in the women's Big Bash League (BBL) in Australia this season, used all her experience to handle the situation and steer India over the line in the last ball of the innings. 
Earlier, electing to bat after winning the toss, South Africa rode on Mignon du Preez (40), Lizelle Lee (37), skipper Dane Van Niekerk (37) and Sune Luus (35) to post 244 in 49.4 overs. ( Mithali Raj is right up there with MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli and other top cricketers ) 
For India, left-arm spinner Rajeshwari Gayakwad took three wickets giving away 51 runs while medium pacer Shikha Pandey picked 2/41. Ekta Bisht, Poonam Yadav and Deepti Sharma took one wicket apiece. 
Brief Scores: South Africa 244 (Mignon du Preez 40, Lizelle Lee 37, Dane Van Niekerk 37, Rajeshwari Gayakwad 3/51, Shikha Pandey 2/41) lose to India 245/9 (Deepti Sharma 71, Mona Meshram 59, Harmanpreet Kaur 41 not out, Marizzane Kapp 2/36) by one wicket. For more news from India Today, follow us on Twitter @indiatoday and on Facebook at facebook.com/IndiaToday For news and videos in Hindi, go to AajTak.in . ताज़ातरीन ख़बरों और वीडियो के लिए आजतक.इन पर आएं.
